definition: to show off/to try to be brave
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: To mature, and who can know the inner childish?
sentences.chinese: 逞強的成熟，又有誰能知其內心的幼稚？

sentences.english: She is fond of flaunting her superiority before her friends and schoolmates.
sentences.chinese: 她好在朋友和同學面前逞強。

sentences.english: Finally understand that strength is also a kind of strong.
sentences.chinese: 終於明白了逞強亦是一種堅強。

sentences.english: If you are ever in trouble do not try to be brave, just run just run away…

sentences.chinese: 你心裏還是忘不了他，別在逞強了，沒用的。

sentences.english: I think I was not so strong, but time and again is try to be brave.
sentences.chinese: 我想我沒那麼堅強，不過是一而再的逞強。

sentences.english: Have that a man can see through my try to be brave, just to protect my fragile.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人能看穿我的逞強，爲了保護我的脆弱。

sentences.english: The remaining mouth trying to flaunt, his eyes unable to support.

sentences.english: Don't heroize,you can't fight against him.
I showed off power I to be afraid, am short your world to jolt lonely.

sentences.english: Russia but tell yourself and opposed Russian not away.
sentences.chinese: 俄無奈告訴自己，逞強並非是俄拋卻。

sentences.english: I want to protect vulnerable people, see through me try to be brave.
sentences.chinese: 希望有個人可以保護我的脆弱，看穿我的逞強。

sentences.english: Don't stretch beyond the point where you begin to feel tightness in the muscle.
sentences.chinese: 不要逞強去拉伸你覺得肌肉密實的部位。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to exercise forbearance/patient and accommodating
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to indulge/to connive at
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
hot-headed/impulsive/reckless
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to have misgivings/apprehension/worry/qualm/scruple
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to blame/to rebuke
indecisive/wavering
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc

one's own view/having definite opinions
